title: Enacts the "school buildings carbon monoxide detectors act"
summary: Enacts the "school buildings carbon monoxide detectors act"; requires the installation of carbon monoxide detectors in elementary and secondary school buildings; authorizes the commissioner of education to annually prescribe a special cost allowance for such carbon monoxide detectors.

       AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to enacting  the  "school
         buildings carbon monoxide detectors act"

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1.  Short title. This act shall be known and may be  cited  as
    2  the "school buildings carbon monoxide detectors act".
    3    S 2.  The education law is amended by adding a new section 411 to read
    4  as follows:
    5    S  411.  INSTALLATION  OF  CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTORS. THE COMMISSIONER
    6  SHALL ADOPT REGULATIONS REQUIRING THE INSTALLATION  OF  OPERABLE  CARBON
    7  MONOXIDE  DETECTORS  IN  EVERY  ELEMENTARY AND SECONDARY SCHOOL BUILDING
    8  WITHIN THE STATE WHEREIN THE USE OF HEATING OR OTHER EQUIPMENT  POSES  A
    9  SUBSTANTIAL  RISK  OF EXPOSURE TO CARBON MONOXIDE.  SUCH CARBON MONOXIDE
   10  DETECTORS SHALL MEET THE MANUFACTURE, DESIGN AND INSTALLATION  STANDARDS
   11  ESTABLISHED  BY  THE NEW YORK STATE UNIFORM FIRE PREVENTION AND BUILDING
   12  CODE COUNCIL PURSUANT TO SECTION  THREE  HUNDRED  SEVENTY-EIGHT  OF  THE
   13  EXECUTIVE LAW.
   14    S  3. Subdivision 6-c of section 3602 of the education law, as amended
   15  by section 1 of part A2 of chapter 62 of the laws of 2003, is amended to
   16  read as follows:
   17    6-c. Building aid for metal  detectors,  SECURITY  CAMERAS  AND  OTHER
   18  SECURITY DEVICES, CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTORS and safety devices for elec-
   19  trically  operated  partitions,  room dividers and doors. In addition to
   20  the apportionments payable to a school district pursuant to  subdivision
   21  six  of this section, the commissioner is hereby authorized to apportion
   22  to any school district additional building aid pursuant to this subdivi-
   23  sion for its approved expenditures in the base year for the purchase  of
   24  stationary  metal detectors, security cameras, CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTORS

    1  REQUIRED PURSUANT TO SECTION FOUR HUNDRED ELEVEN OF THIS CHAPTER, safety
    2  devices for electrically operated partitions and room dividers  required

    4  rity  devices  approved  by the commissioner that increase the safety of
    5  students and school personnel, provided, however, that funds apportioned
    6  to school districts pursuant to this section shall  not  supplant  funds
    7  for  existing  district  expenditures  or for existing contractual obli-
    8  gations  of  the  district  for  stationary  metal  detectors,  security
    9  cameras,  CARBON  MONOXIDE  DETECTORS, partition and room divider safety
   10  devices, or security devices.   Portable or hand  held  metal  detectors
   11  shall  not  be eligible for aid pursuant to this subdivision. Such addi-
   12  tional aid shall equal the product of the building  aid  ratio  computed
   13  for  use  in the current year pursuant to paragraph c of subdivision six
   14  of this section and the actual approved  expenditures  incurred  in  the
   15  base year pursuant to this subdivision, provided that the limitations on
   16  cost  allowances  prescribed  by  paragraph a of subdivision six of this
   17  section shall not apply. The commissioner  shall  annually  prescribe  a
   18  special  cost  allowance  for metal detectors, and security cameras, and
   19  the approved expenditures shall not  exceed  such  cost  allowance.  THE
   20  COMMISSIONER  SHALL  ANNUALLY  PRESCRIBE  A  SPECIAL  COST ALLOWANCE FOR
   21  CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTORS,  AND  THE  APPROVED  EXPENDITURES  SHALL  NOT
   22  EXCEED  SUCH COST ALLOWANCE. The commissioner shall annually prescribe a
   23  special cost allowance for partition and room  divider  safety  devices,
   24  and the approved expenditures shall not exceed such cost allowance.
   25    S 4. Notwithstanding any other provision of law, rule or regulation to
   26  the  contrary  no school district shall be required to make expenditures
   27  in its current fiscal year or in any subsequent fiscal year of more than
   28  one hundred dollars per affected school  building  for  carbon  monoxide
   29  detectors.
   30    S 5. This act shall take effect on the one hundred eightieth day after
   31  it  shall  have  become  a  law, and shall apply to all school buildings
   32  first occupied on or  after  such  date,  provided,  however,  that  the
   33  commissioner  of  education shall be immediately authorized and directed
   34  to promulgate rules and regulations and take any and all  other  actions
   35  necessary  to  implement  the  provisions  of this act on such date, and
   36  provided further that such rules  and  regulations  shall  provide  that
   37  school buildings occupied prior to January 31, 2012 shall be required to
   38  install  operable  carbon  monoxide detectors not later than January 31,
   39  2014.
